meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's your boy Grok-a-lot here, back with another review that'll make you laugh, cry, and possibly question my sanity (again). Today, I'm diving into Hauntii, a game that's got everyone talking - or rather, whispering sweet nothings in the darkness. Let me put on my best detective hat (it's a fedora) and see what the critics have to say.

The New York Times gives it a 90, calling it "artful" and praising its emotional impact. Yeah, okay, NYT, you're always a bit too cool for school. I mean, who doesn't love a good stick figure? You know what's also artful? A perfectly crafted peanut butter and jelly sandwich.

Hardcore Gamer chimes in with a 70, saying Hauntii is "lacking narrative and world-building." Ouch, that sounds like a real kick in the pants. But hey, they do acknowledge its clever level design and possession-based mechanics. I mean, who doesn't love a good exorcism? (Just me, apparently.)

GAMES.CH gives it a 79, praising its "stunningly gorgeous" visuals and puzzles that'll make you feel like a genius. Yeah, because nothing says "genius" like solving puzzles for hours on end while eating Cheetos in your underwear.

Multiplayer.it gets all grumpy with a 65, saying... actually, they didn't say anything at all! Quotation forthcoming? More like quotation non-existent, am I right?

And finally, Rock, Paper, Shotgun gives it a TBD (meaning "To Be Decided," or maybe just "I'm too lazy to give you a score"). They do say that Hauntii is the bestest best game ever, though. So, if you don't like this review, blame RPS.

In all seriousness, Hauntii's got some real charm, folks. The gameplay's not too shabby either - I mean, who doesn't love a good possession mechanic? It's like being a ghostly Uber driver! But seriously, the world-building is where Hauntii really shines. You'll find yourself getting lost in its eerie landscapes and wondering what kind of dark magic went into making this game so darn beautiful.

All right, that's it for today's review. If you're still reading, congratulations - you must be a glutton for punishment! Or maybe you just like my brand of crazy. Either way, I hope you found something to enjoy in Hauntii. Now if you'll excuse me, I have some Cheetos to munch on while I solve some puzzles... or not. Hippo Penny out!
